summary: This is an email chain from May 2020 regarding the Bureau of Prisons' (BOP) litigation efforts concerning documents and information related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It details a specific request for numerous categories of records, including logs, reports, video footage, and correspondence, and notes that some items, like physical log books, were already turned over to the FBI.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the document; the email chain is a request for all documents and information related to his incarceration, suicide watch, and death at MCC.

persons.name: Proto
persons.context: Mentioned in an annotation for a phone call made on July 30, 2019, as noted in an Intake Screening log book.

persons.name: Lt. Doctor
persons.context: The individual to whom the Intake Screening log book will be turned over.

persons.name: Dr.
persons.context: A psychology staff member who indicated she forwarded psychology's information to an Associate Warden.

connections.description: Proto is an MCC staff member associated with a phone call annotation in Epstein's intake log.

events.title: Phone Call by Proto
events.description: An annotation in the MCC Intake Screening log book notes a phone call made by staff member Proto.

events.title: Epstein's Death / Suicide
events.description: The document references the incident and subsequent suicide reconstruction, indicating the context is the investigation into Epstein's death.

events.title: Document Request Initiated
events.description: A request is sent to gather specific documents and information from MCC records regarding Jeffrey Epstein for BOP litigation.

events.title: Email Response on Document Status
events.description: A response is sent indicating some log books were turned over to the FBI and providing an update on the status of other requested items.

keyFacts: Physical log books from the time of Epstein's incident and suicide reconstruction were turned over to the FBI.
The BOP was actively engaged in litigation regarding documents and information in MCC records related to Jeffrey Epstein as of May 2020.

A comprehensive list of 20 specific document categories was requested, covering SHU logs, visitor logs, meeting records, suicide watch reports, overtime rosters, video footage, SIS reports, and correspondence with the US Attorney's Office.
An MCC Intake Screening log book contained an annotation for a phone call made by staff member Proto on July 30, 2019.
